options.text: 3 years.
1 year.

variant.question: Which of the following is obligating for members of ICAO?

options.text: ICAO must be informed about differences from the standards in any of the Annexes to the convention.
ICAO shall approve the pricing of tickets on international airline connections
ICAO must be informed about changes in the national regulations
ICAO must be informed about new flight crew licenses and any suspended validity of such licenses

options.text: it shall give immediate notice to ICAO of the differences between its own practices and the International Standard.
it shall give 45 days notice to ICAO of the differences between its own practices and the International Standard.
it shall give 90 days notice to ICAO of the differences between its own practices and the International Standard.
it shall give 60 days notice to ICAO of the differences between its own practices and the International Standard.

options.text:
Standards and recommended international practices for

annexes.

options.text: Annex 1.

options.text: Chicago 1944
Warsaw 1929
Chicago 1929

variant.question: The Convention which deals with offences against penal law is the

options.text: Convention of Tokyo.
Convention of Madrid.
Convention of Rome.

variant.question: The ICAO Assembly:

options.text: Is convened once every three years
Is in permanent session
Is only convened when requested by the Council
Must be convened at least once every year

variant.question: The Air Navigation Commission consists of:

options.text: ICAO's mission is to serve as the global forum of States for international civil aviation. ICAO develops policies and Standards, undertakes compliance audits, performs studies and analyses, provides assistance and builds aviation capacity through many other activities and the cooperation of its Member States and stakeholders.

ICAO’s mission is to represent, lead and serve the airline industry. ICAO seeks to improve understanding of the industry among decision makers and increase awareness of the benefits that aviation brings to national and global economies. It fights for the interests of airlines across the globe, challenging unreasonable rules and charges, holding regulators and governments to account, and striving for sensible regulation.
ICAO's mission is to approve new international airlines and aircraft.
ICAO produces rules and regulations, and promotes the highest common standards of civil aviation safety and environmental protection in Europe and worldwide.

variant.question: Which of these statements is correct?

options.text: The ICAO Assembly sits every 3 years and elects the 36 members of the Council
The ICAO Council sits every 3 years and elects the 36 members of the Assembly
The ICAO Council sits as required and elects the 36 members of the Assembly, who serve for a 3 year term
The ICAO Assembly sits as required and elects the 36 members of the Council, who serve for a 3 year term

variant.question: Which of the following statements about the structure of ICAO is most correct?

options.text: The Council is elected by the Assembly every three years
Once elected the Council allows the Assembly to carry out the day-to-day running of ICAO
Once elected the Assembly is in permanent session
The Assembly is elected by the Council every three years

variant.question:
Refer to the Convention of Montreal
Any Contracting State may denounce this Convention by written notification to the Depositary Governments.

options.text: Denunciation shall take effect 6 months following the date on which notification is received by the Depositary Governments.
Denunciation shall take effect 4 months following the date on which notification is received by the Depositary Governments.
Denunciation shall take effect 3 months following the date on which notification is received by the Depositary Governments.
Denunciation shall take effect 2 months following the date on which notification is received by the ICAO.

variant.question: The Convention of Tokyo applies to damage

options.text: the above convention does not deal with this item.
caused in the territory of a Contracting State by any aircraft regardless the registration.
only caused in the territory of a Contracting State by an aircraft registered in the territory of another Contracting State.
caused in the territory of a Contracting State or in a ship or aircraft registered there in, by an aircraft registered in the territory of another Contracting State.

approve air fares set by international airlines.

variant.question: According to ICAO, what is correct about the Fatigue Risk Management System (FRMS)?

options.text: FRMS is a data-driven means of continuously monitoring and managing fatigue-related safety risks and can be different for every employer.
Operators from ICAO member states are obliged to install a FRMS, based upon scientific principles and knowledge as well as their individual operational experience.
FRMS does not relieve an operator from complying with the country’s operational requirements concerning flight duty and rest periods.
FRMS comprises a set of rules implemented by ICAO to prevent crew fatigue and ensure that relevant personnel are performing at adequate levels of alertness.

options.text: on a 24 hour basis.
from sunset to sunrise.
when the authority of the Contracting State decides to do so.
when an emergency has been declared.

options.text: Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation
The Safe Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air
Facilitation

Annex 9

variant.question: What is the purpose of ICAO

options.text: to ensure the safe and orderly growth of international civil aviation throughout the world
to ensure aircraft are design in a way that is such to limit the impact on the environment
to designate identified to airfields
to act as the licensing body for all pilots around the world

variant.question: The ICAO definition of an "International Airport" is:

options.text: Any airport designated by the contracting state in whose territory it is situated as an airport of entry and departure for international air traffic, where the formalities incident to customs, immigration, public health, animal and plant quarantine and similar procedures are carried out.
An airport situated on or near the offical border of a contracting state, with the appropriate security and customer handling facilities to properly facilitate international air travel.
Any airport, within a contracting state that accepts international air traffic, whether equipped with formal customs facilities or not.
An airport of a defined passenger handling capacity that offers facilities to carriers and operators with registered offices outside of the contracting state.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 17, the primary objective of States as regards safeguarding civil aviation against acts of unlawful interference is the

options.text: safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel, and the general public.
safety of aerodrome facilities, including landside and airside buildings.
safety of aircraft engaged in international civil operations.
safe application of immigration and customs procedures.

variant.question: Following ICAO, from which age does a person need a passport to travel?

options.text: All ages.
Age of 6 years.
Age of 4 years.
Age of 2 years.

variant.question: When establishing security at an airport, what are the objectives (general principles) with regard to ICAO Annex 17?

options.text: Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel and the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers and crew in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.

Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew and ground personnel in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.

variant.question: By Annex 17 to the ICAO Convention member states are assigned responsibility to implement:

options.text: measures and human and material resources to safeguard international civil aviation.
measures to safeguard civil aviation.
measures to safeguard international civil aviation.
human and material resources to safeguard international civil aviation.
